property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: The former capital of the [[Underground]]. Most monsters had left this area in favor of [[New Home]], the current capital city.

property.name: description
property.value: Toriel's home. She intends for the protagonist to live here with her.

property.name: page
property.value: Toriel's Home

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] calls the protagonist and warns them of the puzzles ahead.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] calls the protagonist and asks them if they dislike the flavor they had not chosen. The protagonist is not given the option to respond.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] calls the protagonist and asks them if they prefer cinnamon or butterscotch. If the protagonist had [[SAVE#Reset|reset their run]] after this point, Toriel automatically guesses what they had chosen and asks them to confirm it.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] calls the protagonist and asks if they have any allergies.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] calls the protagonist and informs them of the various items scattered throughout the Ruins. She warns them not to pick up more than they can carry.

property.name: description
property.value: ''The shadow of the ruins looms above, filling you with determination.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Playfully crinkling through the leaves fills you with determination.''

properties.property: Knowing the mouse might one day leave its hole and get the cheese... It fills you with determination.

property.name: description
property.value: ''Seeing such a cute, tidy house in the RUINS gives you determination.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Only the fearless may proceed. Brave ones, foolish ones. Both walk not the middle road.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Stay on the path.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Press [CONFIRM] to read signs!''

properties.property:
Please press this switch too.
- TORIEL

property.name: description
property.value: ''The western room is the eastern room's blueprint.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Three out of four grey rocks recommend you push them.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Please don't step on the leaves.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''Didn't you read the sign downstairs?''

properties.property: Spider Bake Sale All proceeds go to real spiders.

property.name: page
property.value: Spider Bake Sale

properties.property: Did you miss it? [[Spider Bake Sale|Spider Bakesale]] down and to the right. Come eat food made by spiders, for spiders, of spiders!

property.name: description
property.value: ''There is only one switch.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''The far door is not an exit. It simply marks a rotation in perspective.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''If you can read this, press the blue switch.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''If you can read this, press the red switch.''

property.name: description
property.value: ''If you can read this, press the green switch.''

properties.property: Trapped behind the [[barrier]] and fearful of further [[Humans|human]] attacks, we retreated. Far, far into the earth we walked, until we reached the cavern's end. This was our home, which we named... "[[Home]]." As great as [[Asgore Dreemurr|our king]] is, he is pretty lousy at names.

It's an encyclopedia of subterranean plants. You open to the middle...
"Typha" - A group of wetland flowering plants with brown, oblong seedpods. Known more commonly as "water sausages."

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist is encouraged to take one Monster Candy. The protagonist can take up to four pieces of Monster Candy before the bowl spills onto the floor. In [[Hard Mode]], only three pieces can be taken.

property.name: page
property.value: Monster Candy

property.name: description
property.value: The Faded Ribbon can be picked up here.

property.name: page
property.value: Faded Ribbon

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can pick up the Toy Knife in this area.

property.name: page
property.value: Toy Knife

property.name: description
property.value: Butterscotch-Cinnamon Pie. This item appears after sleeping in the bed. On [[Hard Mode]], this is replaced with [[Snail Pie]].

property.name: page
property.value: Butterscotch Pie

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] introduces the [[Encounter|battle system]] to the protagonist via this [[dummy]]. She asks the protagonist to talk to it, but the protagonist can also kill it, flee from it, or repeatedly perform neutral actions until the dummy becomes bored and leaves automatically.

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter against a [[Froggit]]. [[Toriel]] automatically scares it away after the protagonist's turn.

property.name: description
property.value: Miniboss battle against [[Napstablook]].

property.name: page
property.value: Napstablook/In Battle

property.name: description
property.value: Static encounter against a Vegetoid.

property.name: description
property.value: Static encounter against a Vegetoid.

property.name: description
property.value: Boss battle against Toriel.

property.name: page
property.value: Toriel/In Battle

property.name: description
property.value: The spot where [[Frisk|the protagonist]] enters the [[Underground]]. It is implied that the [[Chara|first human]] is buried here.

property.name: description
property.value: Flowey introduces the protagonist to the concepts of the [[SOUL]], [[Stats#EXP|EXP]], and [[Stats#LOVE|LOVE]]. He attempts to kill the protagonist shortly after but is stopped by [[Toriel]].

property.name: description
property.value: After walking across this room, [[Toriel]] gives the protagonist a cell phone and leaves them alone.

property.name: page
property.value: Cell Phone

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] attempts to call the protagonist again only to discover the protagonist is right in front of her. Toriel guides the protagonist to [[Toriel's Home|her house]].

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can sleep here and recover their HP.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] declares her desire for the protagonist to live with her permanently. Toriel leaves her chair and heads to the basement after the protagonist repeatedly asks her how to leave the Ruins.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Toriel]] repeatedly warns the protagonist of the danger they will face if they leave the Ruins and tells the protagonist to go back upstairs. The protagonist follows her to the exit.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Flowey]] appears at the end of the Ruins and provides commentary based on what the protagonist did.

property.name: description
property.value: Exit to [[Snowdin Forest|Snowdin]]. The protagonist cannot go back to the Ruins after exiting.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must walk across this room without assistance from [[Toriel]].

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy a Spider Donut here for 7G.

property.name: page
property.value: Spider Donut

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist can buy a Spider Cider here for 18G.

property.name: page
property.value: Spider Cider

property.name: description
property.value: The door to the next room unlocks by stepping on the switches that are not on the marked path, then flipping the lever. [[Toriel]] automatically solves this puzzle.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Middle Road Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must flip two switches in order to unlock the next room. [[Toriel]] labeled the correct switches prior to the protagonist's arrival, but they have faded away on [[Hard Mode]].

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Switch Room

property.name: description
property.value: The path forward is blocked by spikes, some of which automatically retract in a pattern indicated by the markings in the eastern room. The protagonist must remember the path shown by the eastern room in order to cross the spikes in the western room. [[Toriel]] guides the protagonist through the puzzle while holding their hand.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Blueprint Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must fall through the cracks on the top floor and go through the rightmost exit on the bottom floor.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Leaf Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must push the rock to the pressure plate in order to retract the spikes blocking the path.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Rock Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must follow the path indicated on the bottom floor to make their way across. If they step on a tile with leaves underneath, they will fall to the bottom floor and must start the puzzle over.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Leaf Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must guide this rock to the pressure plate in order to unlock the way forward.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Rock Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must fall through this crack and flip the switch on the bottom floor in order to proceed.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The One Switch Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The next three rooms are rotations of this room. The protagonist must press the correct switch in each in order to proceed.

property.name: page
property.value: Ruins/Puzzles#The Rotating Puzzle Room

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist lands in this room if they press an incorrect switch. They are taken back to Room 1.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must press this switch to proceed to the next room.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must press this switch to proceed to the next room.

property.name: description
property.value: The protagonist must press this switch to proceed to the next room.

property.name: description
property.value: If [[Toriel]] was spared, she appears at the beginning of the Ruins. She is watering the [[Golden Flowers]] in the area. On the [[True Pacifist Route]], she is replaced with [[Asriel Dreemurr|Asriel]].

property.name: description
property.value: The Froggit informs the protagonist about how to spare enemies. It disappears if any monster is killed.

property.name: page
property.value: Froggit#Main Story

property.name: description
property.value: This [[Froggit]] tells the protagonist how to skip dialogue. It does not show up if the protagonist had skipped dialogue prior to interacting with it.

property.name: description
property.value: An ant-sized [[Froggit]] waves at the protagonist upon discovery.

property.name: description
property.value: This [[Froggit]] teaches the protagonist how to make the game window full screen.

property.name: description
property.value: This [[Froggit]] teaches the protagonist about the significance of yellow names, which appear when an enemy can be spared. It can offer to remove the yellow names or change the color to pink. It also informs the protagonist that they might have to spare an enemy even when their name is not yellow.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Napstablook]] appears here if they were defeated non-violently. They disappear upon realizing that they can fly out of the room.

property.name: description
property.value: This [[Froggit]] informs the protagonist that [[Toriel]] recently went to buy groceries. On [[Hard Mode]], the Froggit says that she came back empty-handed.
